intro: Thymus enervius, commonly known as the slender thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features small, pink or white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are narrow and fragrant, often used in culinary and medicinal applications. Thymus enervius thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and borders.
